Definition of "classic" prolonged fever '''([[Hyperthermia/fever SD-044|hyperthermia/fever]])'''''

* Occurrence in a subject with no particular medical condition (non-immunocompromised, not hospitalised)
* Temperature (taken at rest) ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions,
* For ≥ 3 weeks,
* No cause identified after appropriate investigations carried out during three days in hospital or after three consultations. There is no pre-established, definitive list of these investigations, which vary according to the clinical context of each patient.


Note: there is no pre-established, definitive list of appropriate investigations (which vary depending on the patient) before making the diagnosis of prolonged fever.

question.question: What is the definition of 'classic' prolonged fever?
question.option_a: A temperature of ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions for ≥ 3 weeks in a subject with no particular medical condition, with a cause identified after appropriate investigations carried out during three days in hospital or after three consultations.
question.option_b: A temperature of ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions for ≥ 3 weeks in a subject with no particular medical condition, with no cause identified after appropriate investigations carried out during three days in hospital or after three consultations.
question.option_c: A temperature of ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions for ≥ 2 weeks in a subject with no particular medical condition, with no cause identified after appropriate investigations carried out during three days in hospital or after three consultations.
question.option_d: A temperature of ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions for ≥ 3 weeks in a subject with no particular medical condition, with no cause identified after appropriate investigations carried out during one day in hospital or after one consultation.
